summary.para: Returns the unique, unsigned 32-bit ID of the spatial audio object represented by the buffer. If method was not previously called, this method returns the invalid object ID, -1 (0xffffffff). The invalid ID indicates that the object buffer is unused and contains invalid data.

param.name: pu32ID
param.para: Pointer to a 32-bit variable where the object ID will be stored.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Retrieves a pointer to a buffer that may contain spatial audio metadata.

param.name: ppMetadataItems
param.para: A pointer to an object in which the collection of metadata items will be stored.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: The metadata is written to the collection in a format identified by the MF_MT_SPATIAL_AUDIO_OBJECT_METADATA_FORMAT_ID media type attribute specified during media type negotiation phase of Media Foundation topology construction.

summary.para: Gets the type of the spatial audio object represented by the buffer. If has not been called previously, this method returns the default value of AudioObjectType_None.

param.name: pType
param.para: A pointer to an variable where the audio object type will be stored.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Sets the ID of the spatial audio object represented by the buffer.

param.name: u32ID
param.para: A 32-bit unsigned unique ID of the audio object.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: The object ID must be unique for each spatial audio sample. Subsequent samples can contain spatial audio objects with the same IDs to represent moving dynamic objects or constant static objects.

summary.para: Sets the type of the spatial audio object represented by the buffer.

param.name: type
param.para: A value from the enumeration specifying the type of audio object.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: A spatial audio object can be of type AudioObjectType_Dynamic, which means that it can change position and orientation in 3D space over time, or it can have a value such as AudioObjectType_FrontLeft which represents the static position of a real or virtual speaker that does not change position over time.

summary.para: Represents a section of audio data with associated positional and rendering metadata. Spatial audio objects are stored in instances, and allow passing of spatial audio information between Media Foundation components.

remarks.para: To get the audio data contained in the spatial audio object, use the and methods.
